newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Santos port union to vote on ending strike.
newsitem.headline: Santos port union to vote on ending strike.

text.p: The Administrative Portworkers' Union at Brazil's key port of Santos was due to vote at 1930 local/2200 GMT on a proposal by port authorities to resume work immediately, a union spokesman said.
"(The port authority) Codesp made a proposal of an immediate return to work," said Ademir Estevessa after round-table talks at the regional delegation of the Labour Ministry in Santos.
Warehouse workers, who have been striking since 0700/1000 over a dispute over backpay, were due to vote on the proposal later.
If they agree to return to work, Codesp will hold talks at 09301230 on Feb 25 to discuss the working conditions of warehouse workers.

"These negotiations will be specifically about the labour market conditions of warehouse workers," Estevessa said. "In a second phase, they would then discuss resuming the payment of a production salary which was suspended in July of last year."
Union officials earlier said the strike was affecting 90 percent of imports as well as a smaller percentage of exports. But port officials said exports were unaffected by the strike.
